Award.AbstractNarration:
The Mathematisches Forschungsinstitut Oberwolfach (MFO) in Germany is one of the leading mathematical research centers worldwide. MFO host approximateluy 2,500 internationally renowned guest researchers each year. These scientists come from all over the world, with more than 20% coming from the United States. The scientific programs of the MFO cover all important topics and new developments in mathematics and its applications in science and technology.

This award provides funding to support the participation of additional US-based young researchers, called "US Junior Oberwolfach Fellows", in Oberwolfach activities. Participation in the workshops and seminars will give these researchers the opportunity to meet top senior scientists from all over the world and gain experience in the scientific community. The award provides partial support for 100 US Junior Oberwolfach Fellowships per year, in average 2 young scientists per week (graduate students and postdocs with at most 10 years after Ph.D.), starting in April 2011, with a duration of 5 years.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Mathematisches Forschungsinstitut Oberwolfach (MFO) is an established international mathematical research centre enabling the dissipation of new knowledge in mathematics and its applications, the initiation of new research projects and the interdisciplinary interaction of leading junior and senior researchers. Annually nearly 3000 selected scientific visitors engage in the weeklong intensive research programs of the MFO that are monitored by an international scientific committee. The project "US Junior Oberwolfach fellows" aims to support the participation in these programs of annually 100 gifted graduate students and postdocs from US universities and institutes with at most 10 years experience after their PhD. This gives them the possibility at an early stage of their career to interact and network with top senior scientists from all over the world in an intense research atmosphere without distractions. In this way the next generation of US mathematicians receives training and access to senior colleagues at the highest level, benefitting the whole field, their home institutions and their own career. The broad scope of the workshop program at the MFO ensures that a wide-ranging set of skills is aquired by the US Junior Oberwolfach Fellows that benefits all of society since mathematical techniques are prevalent in all areas of science and technology.


The MFO runs its week-long scientific activities in 4 central programs which cover all fields of mathematics including applications in other sciences: The Oberwolfach Workshops, the Mini-Workshops, the Arbeitsgemeinschaften, and the Oberwolfach Seminars. The main scientific program consists of 40 week-long workshops per year, each with about 50 participants, organised by internationally leading experts selected by a scientific committee. The Mini-Workshop program offers 12 week-long mini-workshops with about 15 participants per year. In all workshops the US Junior Oberwolfach fellows have the opportunity to attend lectures, discuss and work with senior participants and to possibly already present results of their own. In the Arbeitsgemeinschaft (Study Group) junior as well as senior researchers learn about a new active topic outside their current area of research by active presentations of the material. The 6 Oberwolfach Seminars are graduate schools organised by leading experts in the field and address PhD students and postdocs from all over the world. In average over all activities, the project "US Junior Oberwolfach Fellows" has allowed to support 2 fellows per week continuously from 2011 to 2016, in total 512 fellows over a 5 years period.
